subject: Re: [junit] Re: Mock objects...
msgSnippet: ... If that s so, then set up your dynamic mocks so that order for those methods doesn t matter. As far as I know, jMock supports this. Also, if you re using a
messageBody:
Kevin Klinemeier wrote:

> I fear dynamic mock objects, but like many fears, it may be because I
> haven't used them.
>
> I have some readability concerns, but the big issue I had was the list
> approach to specifying return data (return this on the first call, this
> on the second call, etc). In my JDBC and HTTP tests, this has made a
> few tests kind of brittle when the order or number of calls to an
> accessor method has changed. The code still works, it also still
> conforms to the expectations of the interface, it just does things a
> little differently.

If that's so, then set up your dynamic mocks so that order for those
methods doesn't matter. As far as I know, jMock supports this.

Also, if you're using a dynamic mock "only" as a fake -- that is, to
provide hardcoded data -- then simply don't verify().
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
